column4: ok so I am back to square one here. my computer refuses to contact the router. I'm running Kubuntu 8.04 my hardware LEDs are working, I have set static ip info in /etc/network/interfaces and I have now tried 2 different ethernet cards (in different slots) with the same results! please help me! people last time seemed to think it was a hardware problem but I'm sure there's something were missing here!
what type of network cards did you try?
well the real tek should definately work
perhaps you are setting a static ip outside of the routers range
that's why I purchased it. is sky2 the driver?
no it should be like rt something or other.
that will show you modules running for all pci hardware
no idea what sky2 is sry
you can rmmod the module you don't want.
rmmod will not remove it on next boot only immediately
you would have to blacklist it to remove on boot
network support should just be working right out of the box for the card you described. Your problem is lying elsewhere. Like settings etc... Try DHCP'ng from the router instead of static.
then if that works then you can play with settings
Sry I can't help you more right now i'm kind of distracted perhaps someone else can get you on the right track.
you don't need to retype your password everytime.
